scheduler 0.0.0.9000

Specify the weeks of a schedule

Source: R/week.R
in_week.Rd

in_week() returns the number of complete seven day periods that have occurred between the date and January 1st, plus one.

The in_isoweek() function returns the week as it would appear in the ISO 8601 system, which uses a reoccurring leap week.

in_week(...)

in_isoweek(...)

Arguments

...

a numeric vector of week elements.

Value

A schedule of events occuring in the weeks specified.

Details

Creates a schedule of events occuring in the weeks specified.

Examples

my_dates <- c(as.Date("2000-01-01"),
              as.Date("2000-02-01"),
              as.Date("2000-03-01"),
              as.Date("2000-04-01"))

my_dates
#> [1] "2000-01-01" "2000-02-01" "2000-03-01" "2000-04-01"

in_january <- in_month("January")
in_january(my_dates)
#> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE

in_february <- in_month("Feb")
in_february(my_dates)
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE

in_march <- in_month(3)
in_march(my_dates)
#> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE

in_jan_or_feb <- in_month("Jan", "Feb")
in_jan_or_feb(my_dates)
#> [1]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE

## You can even mix your month specs.
in_jan_feb_mar <- in_month("January", "Feb", 3)
in_jan_feb_mar(my_dates)
#> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE

## invalid inputs will produce an immediate error

# NOT RUN {
in_january <- in_month("Janu")
in_january <- in_month(13)
# }
